data.title: NBA: Derek Fisher to re-sign with the Oklahoma City Thunder
data.meta_description: Veteran point guard Derek Fisher will start the season with the Oklahoma City Thunder for a change, agreeing to re-sign with his previous club for the veteran's minimum ($1.4 million), Darnell Mayberry of the Oklahoman reported.
data.text:
Published July 25, 2013 7:35am

Andrew Innerarity / REUTERS

Veteran point guard Derek Fisher will start the season with the Oklahoma City Thunder for a change, agreeing to re-sign with his previous club for the veteran's minimum ($1.4 million), Darnell Mayberry of the Oklahoman reported.

Fisher is expected to sign a one-year deal.

The 1996 draft pick had been a mid-season addition the previous two years for the Thunder. In 2012-13, he played nine games for the Dallas Mavericks before getting injured and asking for his release. He then returned to Oklahoma City in February as the team's third-string point guard.

In 24 regular season games with the Thunder, he normed 4.1 points, 0.9 rebounds and 0.7 assists. During the playoffs, Russell Westbrook's injury led to him seeing more playing time, with his numbers increasing to 8.7 points (47.1 percent on three-pointers), 1.5 rebounds and .07 assists. - AMD, GMA News
